summary: Nearly 100,000 people in the U.S. died of drug overdoses from July 2023-June 2024. A vast majority of those deaths—about 75%—involved opioids. Since FY 2018, the lead federal health agency for the opioid crisis awarded about $8.1 billion to states and $307.5 million to tribes to address it. title: Opioid Use Disorder Grants: Opportunities Exist to Improve Data Collection, Share Information, and Ease Reporting Burden
